resources.string:
carbohydrates :

1.100 grams rice contains 216.16 cal
2.100 grams wheat contains 555.84 
cal3.1 cups corn contains 316.52 cal

Workes of carbohydrates :

The two main functions of carbohydrates in the body are to provide energy for all cells and spare the use of protein from the muscles and organs Carbs help maintain blood glucose during exercise and restore muscle glycogen during rest and recovery from exercise.

Protion:

The recommended daily intake (RDI) for protein is 46 grams for women and 56 grams for men.

1.one Egg -> 78 calories.
2. Chicken 1kg -> 284 calories.
3.Milk 1 cup -> 149 calories.

Workes of Protein :

Protein is an important component of every cell in the body. Your body uses protein to build and repair tissues.

Fats:

1.Nuts 100 grams -> 416.88 calories.
2.Extra Virgin Olive Oil 100 grams -> 108.08 calories.
3.Dark Chocolate 100 grams -> 329.1036 calories.

Workes of Fats :

Dietary fats are essential to give your body energy and to support cell growth.

Vitamin:

There are 13 essential vitamins: A, D, E, and K, which are fat-soluble.
\n
 Vitamin A - comes from orange colored fruits and vegetables; dark leafy greens, like kale
 
 Vitamin D - can be found in fortified milk and dairy products; cereals; (and of course, sunshine!)

Vitamin E - is found in fortified cereals; leafy green vegetables; seeds; nuts

Vitamin K - can be found in dark green leafy vegetables.

1.Water Protects Your Tissues, Spinal Cord, and Joints
2.Water Helps Your Body Remove Waste
3.Water Aids in Digestion
4.Water Prevents You From Becoming Dehydrated
